intro: Strobilanthes mastersii, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame of the forest," is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery red bracts that resemble flowers. The plant is known for its unique floral structure, with the actual flowers being small and clustered within the showy bracts. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections around the world.
